overview: A research topic selected in consultation with the allocated supervisor. Enrolment in the thesis is across two consecutive semesters and students must enrol in the subject in each semester to ensure they are meeting the full 50 point requirement for the year-long subject.
intended learning outcomes: Develop and complete a significant research project which is written up and presented as a 15,000 word dissertation
Develop skills in scholarly investigation and critical analysis appropriate to screen and cultural studies
Enhance research capacity and to improve writing skills under supervision.

additional pre-requisite: Students enrolled in the thesis must also complete SCRN40019 Screen & Cultural Research Seminar (may be undertaken concurrently).

Students that commenced the Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in Screen and Cultural Studies or Graduate Diploma (Advanced) in Screen Studies or Cultural Studies  prior to 2022 and have already completed ARTS40001 Research Principles and Practices are not required to undertake SCRN40019.
This subject is only available to Screen and Cultural Studies Specialisation students enrolled in a BH-Arts, Bachelor of Arts (Degree with Honours) or a GDA-Arts, Graduate Diploma (Advanced) in Arts.

non-allowed subjects: SCRN40014 Screen and Cultural Studies Thesis

assessments.description: A thesis on an approved topic written over two consecutive semesters. 15,000 words
assessments.timing: Due at the end of the second semester of enrolment

assessments.description: Hurdle requirement:. 1.	Students are required to attend a minimum of 80% of supervision meetings in order to qualify to have their written work assessed.

Hurdle requirement:. 2.	Late Penalty and Assessment hurdle requirement: Assessment submitted late without an approved extension will be penalised at five per cent (5%) of the possible marks available for the assessment task per day or part thereof. All pieces of assessment must be submitted to pass the subject.  Each submitted assessment must be complete, constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task and will not be accepted after 20 University business days from the original assessment due date without written approval.

Semester 1.Contact hours: Regular, documented consultations over two semesters with the supervisor(s) as arranged. Meetings should normally occur at least fortnightly and should be at least of half an hour duration.

Semester 2.Contact hours: Regular, documented consultations over two semesters with the supervisor(s) as arranged. Meetings should normally occur at least fortnightly and should be at least of half an hour duration.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
